intro: Pimelea actea, commonly known as the yellow pimelea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine, white hairs. Pimelea actea is typically found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
